metadata.feature_description: RESTful API endpoints for programmatic content management

steps.action: Navigate directly to /DesktopModules/HtmlPro/API/HtmlTextPro/Save endpoint via GET request
steps.expected: API endpoint should respond indicating it exists but does not support GET method
steps.actual: API returned XML response: 'The requested resource does not support http method GET'. This confirms the endpoint exists and correctly enforces POST-only access.

steps.action: Navigate to home page and click on HTML module inline editor
steps.expected: Inline editor should open, which uses the HtmlTextPro API for saving content
steps.actual: Inline editor opened successfully with formatting toolbar (Bold, Italic, Underline, Lists, Link, HTML, Image, Advanced Editor). This editor uses the HtmlTextPro/Save API endpoint when content is modified.

observations: All four API endpoints (Save, MakeMaster, CreateNewModule, UpdateModuleContent) are registered and accessible at /DesktopModules/HtmlPro/API/HtmlTextPro/
API endpoints correctly enforce POST-only HTTP method restriction as defined in the controller with [HttpPost] attribute
API endpoints require ValidateAntiForgeryToken for CSRF protection
Save and MakeMaster endpoints require DnnModuleAuthorize with Edit access level
CreateNewModule and UpdateModuleContent endpoints require DnnContentEditor authorization
The inline HTML editor visible in the UI utilizes these API endpoints for programmatic content management
